review_text: While the home and land were beautiful there were some serious issues we had. I feel like if a renter says they'll be in late, you should turn on some lights to see especially when it's women traveling alone and its as dark as it is. I also feel like, if I've messaged you immediately after booking about you should message back at least to let me know you won't be there or that you got the message. Check-In directions weren't very clear and the communication could have been much better. I can say that once he did message back he was very nice but the communication was lacking, especially compared to the last two times I used AirBnB and the owners were amazingly communicative. Other issues were that the dogs were barking at 6am and woke us up and since we got in so late it would've been nice to sleep later than 6. Then when I went outside in the morning the black dog was snarling, growling, and biting and lunging at me and while I understand that dogs are protective of their food, if you have a dog that behaves in this manner, they shouldn't be allowed out where paying guests can come across them. Thankfully, I've been around dogs my entire life and knew to stop moving, avoid eye contact, and back away but I was TERRIFIED of being attacked, especially since I was out there alone for no one to help. I ended up walking around the garage and approaching the door from behind so that I could get back in without crossing in front of the dog. There was also nothing at the end of the driveway to make it easier to spot the driveway in the dark. Reflectors and a solar powered landscape light would go a long way in helping renters find this place in the dark bc it's BLACK out there where it's so far out. Again, the home was beautiful and extremely clean but the experience wasn't as pleasant as we'd hoped. I honestly would LOVE to come back with spouse because I know he'd love this place but I'd like to see these changes take place before doing so and then I'd be more than happy to leave a 5 star review. For anyone reading this review, while my star rating is not high, I can say that if you like the way this place looks and really want to stay, reach out to the owner to see if these changes have been made bc if so, I think you'd really love it. Also, remember Texas is summer is swelteringly hot. We live in Louisiana so we're used to it but people who aren't from the south aren't and it's tough. I hope that this review helps effect the changes that are needed to make this place go from OK to GREAT bc it's potential is definitely great.

WOW. This property was everything it represented itself to be, and so much more! Communication was exceptional! Tracy let us know about many of the "staple items" that would be present in the home. However, the amenities and thoughtfulness of provisions FAR EXCEEDED our expectations, even our hopes.
Pots overflowing with succulents and plants are scattered everywhere in front of and inside the home. Fresh flowers and fragrance from wax warmers greeted us. In the kitchen, we found a basket of dry goods (raisins, applesauce, oatmeal, granola bars), in the freezer a loaf of bread, in the fridge fresh farm eggs. USB hubs all over. We were traveling with four children, aged 2-8. The kids loved the airplane room, so many toys, baskets of activities, chalk... everything they wanted and more was there for them to enjoy. We found a booster seat in the garage, travel games, board games, kinetic sand, cards, dominoes, sensory toys, a craft box... it was amazing. The decor and accents are staged in such a way that everything was either out of reach for the kids or totally fair game and safe. As a parent, that provided a space to truly relax.
The kitchen is so well appointed it's almost too good to really be able to convey. Everything we reached for we found, from coffee filters and extra Kcups to baking sheets and muffin tins. The cast iron selection and multiple sets of dishes were so nice; we even found plastic dishes for the kids and disposable flatware in the cupboard. The pantry boasted a TON of standard spices as well as dry goods (rice, beans, frosted mini wheats, and lucky charms), and beside the stove we found the homemade spice blends.
The SPACE in this house is unreal. So much room to gather all together or scatter into small groups. The kids were loud and rowdy and we still were able to enjoy peaceful separation in the living room. The showers are large and boasted stone floors and all toiletries. Even the outside is so spacious and comfortable! The property is at the end of a street with a huge front, side, and back yard. The porch view is so peaceful, and the cicadas and birds sang out the whole time. It was lovely porch sitting.
I can't wait to escape to this property again. We had kicked around the idea of a river day or maybe even driving into Port Lavaca for a beach day. But the home was so inviting and comfortable, we decided to just stay in and enjoy an intimate and low-key weekend together. It truly felt like an escape at this comfy hideaway!
